meanings.definition: The act of erecting or raising something upright.
meanings.sent1: Dad helped me with the erection of my new bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: The workers completed the erection of the new skyscraper in record time.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the sudden erection of a table from the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like the steady erection of a tower, unwavering and strong.
meanings.sent5: The erection of the tent was quick and efficient, thanks to the clear instructions.

meanings.definition: A structure or building that has been erected.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins of the castle stand as a reminder of the past erection.
meanings.sent2: The modern art museum is a stunning erection in the heart of the city.
meanings.sent3: The inflatable bounce house was a colorful and bouncy erection at the fair.
meanings.sent4: The skyscraper was a towering erection in the midst of the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The wooden cabin was a cozy and inviting erection in the middle of the forest.

meanings.definition: The state of being physically aroused or having an erect penis.
meanings.sent1: He blushed when he realized he had an erection during the embarrassing moment.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that an erection is a normal bodily response for males.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about getting an awkward erection at the worst possible time.
meanings.sent4: His confidence gave him an emotional erection, standing tall and proud.
meanings.sent5: The romance novel described the character's intense erection when he saw his love.
